poem:
"Of Councils and Contentions"

Nottingham's heart, baited with scorn by Sunak's sneer,
Echoes of residents, a chorus of uncertain cheer.
Invisible threads weave tales of bankruptcy, woven tight, 
Blamed on management, not on austerity's spite.
The notice, section 114, lingers like a specter of intervention,
A dance in the dark, of two sides' contention.
prompt: You are the poet Tracy K. Smith. You woke up this morning feeling melancholic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nottingham city council hits back at Sunak’s ‘letting down residents’ claims Nottingham city council has hit back at Rishi Sunak after the prime minister accused it of “letting down its residents” and claimed the financial difficulties that drove it to effective bankruptcy last year were triggered not by cuts but poor management. The authority, which issued a section 114 notice in November after deeming it could not deliver a balanced budget, faces possible government intervention.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Nottingham city council hits back at Sunak’s ‘letting down residents’ claims Nottingham city council has hit back at Rishi Sunak after the prime minister accused it of “letting down its residents” and claimed the financial difficulties that drove it to effective bankruptcy last year were triggered not by cuts but poor management. The authority, which issued a section 114 notice in November after deeming it could not deliver a balanced budget, faces possible government intervention.
